PROGRAM PERFORMANCE PROFILE
Ang Cavite State University ay makakapagbigay ng mahusay, pantay at makabuluhang edukasyon sa sining agham at teknolohiya sa pamamagitan ng
may kalidad na pagtuturo at tumutugon sa pangangailangang pananaliksik at mga gawaing pangka unlaran. Makakalikha ito ng indibidwal na dalubhasa, may
kasanayan at kagandahang asal para sa pandaigdigang kakayahan.
• The Filipino translation of the University Mission was approved per BOR
Resolution No. 89 series of 2011 dated November 29, 2011.
➢ Goals of the Academic Unit
In support to the Vision and Mission of the University, CvSU Trece Martires City Campus shall:
1. Provide high quality instruction in order to produce skilled, morally upright and globally competitive graduates.
2. Develop and pursue advance research activities through arts, sciences and
technology to support instruction. 3. Develop and conduct extension activities that will empower people and
communities. Towards these ends, the Information Technology Department exerts its utmost effort to:
1. Support the university’s mission and vision in providing globally competitive individuals through technological advancements;
2. Equip students with knowledge in the field of information and computer technology;
and 3. Strengthen students’ skills through research development and extension activities
that will endow their personal and social growth.

➢ State the Objectives/Outcomes of the Program (CMO No. 25 Series of 2015)
The Bachelor of Science in Information Technology program prepares students to be IT Professionals, be well versed on application installation, operation, development,
maintenance and administration, and familiar with hardware installation, operation and
maintenance.
A graduate of Bachelor in Information Technology can be: 1. Applications developer 2. Database administrator 3. Entrepreneur in IT Industry 4. Information Security Administrator 5. Information Technology Instructor 6. Network Administrator 7. Network Engineer 8. System Analyst 9. Technical Support Specialist 10. Test Engineer 11. Web Master/Web Administrator 12. Web Developer
The Bachelor of Science in Information Technology program aims to produce graduates who can:
1. Apply knowledge of utilization of both hardware and software technologies involving planning, installing, customizing, operating, managing and administering,
and maintaining information technology infrastructure that provides computing
solutions to address the needs of an organization; 2. Conduct relevant researches ad extension program activities in the field of
information technology; 3. Promote the development and transfer of appropriate information technology;
4. Promote environmental preservation and protection on projects and enterprises related to information technology; and
5. Become morally upright IT professionals with primary or secondary job roles.

➢ Illustrates and describes the historical formulation, monitoring and review of the VMGO.
As stated in the University’s Manual of Operations, the University Vision-Mission statement was framed in 2001.
On 2005, a Memorandum of Agreement was signed on the establishment of the
CvSU Trece Martires City Campus and it became operationalized in June 2005 through BOR Resolution No. 41 Series of 2005. CvSu-Trece Martires City Campus then
formulated its goals and objectives including the Department of Information Technology having the Bachelor in Information Technology, Associate in Computer Secretarial and
Certificate in Computer Technician as programs. President Hernando D. Robles included the review/revisit/revision of the University
Vision and Mission in the Management Training and Strategic Planning Workshop held
on January 24, 2017 together with the members of the administrative council, College/Campus Deans and Administrators, Directors and Unit heads. The activity was
also participated by representatives from the students, alumni, community, industry and
research and extension partners, and other planning stakeholders. T3 Campuses (Tanza, Trece and General Trias) goals were revised on May 9,
2018 during the Curriculum and Instruction Committee meeting. In which, the unified department objectives across T3 Campuses were also reviewed and revised .

2. IMPLEMENTATION
➢ VMGO dissemination activities, and provide captions to all pictures (if
necessary)
Orientation program was always conducted for students and newly hired faculty
members. Part of the program is the discussion of the VMGO. Dissemination of VMGO of the University was done by including it in most media
and forms such as brochures, programs, invitations, bulletin of information, exams, office
forms, and campus newsletter. Dissemination of VMGO statements were also done through non-printed materials such as the CvSU website and social media accounts.
Faculty members are required to include the VMGOs of the university as part of their course syllabi. In this manner, old and new students are oriented/ re-oriented in the
mission, vision, statements of the university every semester. The Department of Information Technology conducted meetings to discuss the programs
educational program objectives/outcome and the target job for the graduates. On May
09, 2018, the T3 Campuses conducted the review and revision of its goals and the different department objectives. Faculty members and students of the Department of
Information Technology also participated in the study on awareness, understanding, acceptance and perception of CvSu-Trece Martires City Campus stakeholders towards
its Vision, Mission, Goals and Objectives.

3. OUTCOMES
➢ The results of the research study in awareness and acceptability of the VMGO by the different stakeholders
The study was conducted by J.A. Arbigoso, R,p/ Miranda and K. A. Paculan last June 2019 entitled Awareness, Acceptance and Perception of CvSU Trece Martires City
Campus Stakeholders towards its Vision, Mission, Goals and Objectives.
Based on the result of the study conducted, the following conclusions were drawn:
1. Internal stakeholders including students of different programs, faculty members
and staff are highly aware of the VMGO while external stakeholders such as parents/guardians, alumni, cooperating agencies, snd other linkages are aware
of the campus VMGO.
2. Internal stakeholders understand and greatly accept the VMGO while external stakeholders understand and accept the VMGO.
3. Both external and internal stakeholders agreed to the CvSU VMGO. 4. There is a correlation between the awareness, acceptance and perception of
VMGO by the internal and external stakeholders. 5. There is a significant difference between the internal and external
stakeholders level of awareness, acceptance and perception towards VMGO.

➢ The implementation of the VMGO and their congruence with educational practices and activities.
Most of the universities and colleges were established by virtue of the national
legislation. Its mandate is to serve its service through the provision of quality and
affordable education. Aside from instruction, these learning institutions are mandated to perform research extension and production.
To meet the above functions every learning institution has to establish its own vision and mission that is in harmony with the national, regional, provincial and local
development goals, thrusts, policies and directions. Cavite State University Trece Martires City Campus has established similarly its
goals in support with the University’s vision and mission. With these in mind, all
activities, plans and development directions are conducted, implemented and prepared toward the achievement of these guiding principles: National Economic Development
Plan, RA 8468: CvSU’s Legal and Educational Mandate, and Cavite State Univeristy
(CvSU) Manual of Operations.
Guided by the University vision and mission and goals of the campus, the Program Intended learning Outcomes were also prepared.
To determine the congruence of all activities, plans, and development directions
of the campus and its curricular programs with the University vision and mission, a
continuing study on the acceptance and awareness of the vision and mission of the institution, goals of the campus, and objectives of the programs by its clients and other
stake holders has been conducted. The respondents of the study came from each of the target groups (students,
administration, faculty, support staff, parents, alumni, cooperating agencies, linkages and the general public) of the CvSU Trece Martires City Campus.
